document.title: Childbirth in Chains: A Report on the Cruel but not so Unusual Practice of Shackling Incarcerated Pregnant Females in the United States
document.publication-title: Tennessee Journal of Race, Gender, & Social Justice

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Alison Smock is a 2008 graduate of the Ohio State University and a 2014 graduate of the University of Tennessee College of Law. She also holds a certificate in Nonprofit Management from Duke University and currently resides in Cincinnati, Ohio where she is active in both the legal and nonprofit sectors.
